meanings.definition: Think out or plan (an action, especially a crime) beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Before stealing the cookies, Tim spent hours premeditating the perfect plan.
meanings.sent2: The detective suspected the criminal was premeditating the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be premeditating a way to catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The students were premeditating their escape from the boring lecture hall.
meanings.sent5: She was premeditating her revenge, plotting each step carefully.

meanings.sent1: Sarah always premeditates her outfit choices the night before.
meanings.sent2: Before the trip, they were premeditating the best route to take.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was premeditating how to reach the bird feeder without being seen.
meanings.sent4: The team was premeditating their strategy for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent5: He was premeditating his speech, rehearsing each word in his mind.
